comment.author: 92601516@N02
comment._content: This building is still standing and is at the corner of Grote and Morphett Streets

comment.author: 92888289@N08
comment._content: The Model Schools opened at the corner of Grote St and Brown St, Adelaide on Monday. 26th January 1874. trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/39820348/3990438 By June 1876 the erection of an adjoining Teachers’ College was completed. trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/43004821

comment.author: 92968388@N06
comment._content: In 1908 the school on Grote Street became Adelaide High School.  Later, due to increasing student numbers two sites were occupied, one in Grote street and one in Currie Street.  After WW2 it was decided to build a new school on the corner of West Terrace and Glover Avenue.  This became Adelaide Boys High School while the Grote Street buildings became Adelaide Girls High School.  In 2007 the buildings became a performing arts centre.
